result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T. Bierdemann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--To pay fine of $100 + costs = $379 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $579 + $50 drug testing fee = $629; due in $50 increments per month beginning 9/30/15 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 13 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--No suspension of driving privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T. Bierdemann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Fine Paid
Time To Pay / Payment Extension Reminder

Cases 15CM138 & 15CT184 called together at 10:53 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC & FSSC)
Defendant Michael T. Bierdemann in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa submits plea paperwork; Court reviews criminal case settlement with Mr. Bierdemann
off-record: 10:59 - am for Atty De La Rosa to consult with client

15CT184: Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1 the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 35 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence 8/5/15 by 6:00 pm
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $400 + costs + $200 DNA Surcharge  = $1442 + $59.06 blood testing fee (FAPD) = $1501.06; due in $50 increments per month beginning 9/30/15 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 31 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 14 months
--6 demerit points assessed
Court continues bond until commencement of jail term

15CM138: Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Count #2 the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To pay fine of $100 + costs = $379 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $579 + $50 drug testing fee = $629; due in $50 increments per month beginning 9/30/15 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 13 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--No suspension of driving privileges
Recess: 11:24 am
Status conference on July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Michael T. Bierdemann in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 9:39 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA Pre-trial Conference before STC in July - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/17/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices
